gui_main

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui_main.GUI

  • public final class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides easy access to the GUI features. Se javadoc at: github
    Author:
    Ronnie Dalsgaard (s093487) with input and adjustments by Daniel Rubin-Gr√∏n (daniel@koru.dk) Version 3.1 updates by Christian Budtz (chbu@dtu.dk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI(GUI_Field[] fields,
           java.awt.Color backGroundColor)
        Constructor for GUI. Accepts an an array of GUI fields. Order of fields in array determine order of fields. Call any function on gui to show gui (ie. gui.showMessage). Board will try to resize to accommodate fields. Invoke GUI.set_null_fields_allowed prior to allow null fields (not recommendable)
        Parameters:
        fields -

      • GUI

        public GUI(GUI_Field[] fields)

      • GUI

        public GUI()
        Constructor for GUI. Creates default Matador board Call any function on gui to show gui (ie. gui.showMessage).
        Parameters:
        fields -

      • showMessage

        public void showMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Displays a message to the user.
        Breaks the system untill "OK" is pressed.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to print.

      • getUserString

        public java.lang.String getUserString(java.lang.String msg)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        Returns:
        The string that the user has entered.

      • getUserInteger

        public int getUserInteger(java.lang.String msg,
                          int min,
                          int max)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the integer response. Only values between min and max are allowed.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        min - The minimum value the user is allowed to enter.
        max - The maximum value the user is allowed to enter.
        Returns:
        The integer that the user selected.

      • getUserInteger

        Displays a message to the user and awaits the integer response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        Returns:
        The integer that the user selected.

      • getUserButtonPressed

        public java.lang.String getUserButtonPressed(java.lang.String msg,
                                             java.lang.String... buttons)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the button pressed response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        buttons - A number of strings that should be printed on the buttons the user can press.
        Returns:
        The string from the button that the user pressed.

      • getUserSelection

        public java.lang.String getUserSelection(java.lang.String msg,
                                         java.lang.String... options)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the drop-down response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        options - A number of strings with the texts that the user should choose from.
        Returns:
        The string that the user selected.

      • getUserLeftButtonPressed

        public boolean getUserLeftButtonPressed(java.lang.String msg,
                                        java.lang.String trueButton,
                                        java.lang.String falseButton)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the boolean response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that promts the user.
        trueButton - The text that should appear on the left button.
        falseButton - The text that should appear on the right button.
        Returns:
        True if the left button is pressed by the user. False otherwise.

      • addPlayer

        public boolean addPlayer(GUI_Player player)
        Adds a player to the board.
        Max. 6 players.
        Parameters:
        name - : String (Mind the length!) (Unique identifier of the player - no duplicates)
        balance - : int
        car - : Car Cars are created this way:
        Car car = new Car.Builder()
        .primaryColor(Color.MAGENTA)
        .secondaryColor(Color.BLUE)
        .typeTractor()
        .patternDotted()
        .Build();
        Returns:
        true if player is added, otherwise false

      • setDice

        public void setDice(int faceValue1,
                    int rotation1,
                    int x1,
                    int y1,
                    int faceValue2,
                    int rotation2,
                    int x2,
                    int y2)
        Shows two dice on the board. The dice will have the specified values, but the placement is random.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - : int [1:6]
        rotation1 - : int [0:360]
        faceValue2 - : int [1:6]
        rotation2 - : int [0:360[
        x1 - : int [0:11]
        y1 - : int [0:11]
        x2 - : int [0:11]
        y2 - : int [0:11]
        (If a parameter is out of bounds nothing will happen!)

      • setDice

        public void setDice(int faceValue1,
                    int faceValue2)
        Shows two dice on the board. The dice will have the specified values, but the placement is random.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - : int [1:6]
        faceValue2 - : int [1:6]
        (If a parameter is out of bounds nothing will happen!) Uses random rotation.
